I am going back to Kansas City bitches! Another Tech Sales Manager training...two within 3 months of each other isn't bad...and free shit is AWESOME!

June 12th-15th!

And in other news, I played golf Tuesday...and shot a 120...and actually made par on a hole for the first time ever!

PGA HERE I COME!!!

Out,
Thomas
http://giveit2gem.livejournal.com/53925.html

So the last few days...phew...crazy!

Got a second roomie yesterday...his name is Tom...yes, that SHOULD cause some confusion in the near future...anyway, he moved in, and had to give him my house key till we get another made (this will be relevant soon)

So after work today, I leave, and Nate is still out front waiting for his ride. I offer to give him a ride to Citrus County, but he told me he has his friends and gf on the way up...but in the mean time, we went to Denny's with Abu to have some food til they get there. His friends were hilarious...and yeah, it was a good time at the ole Villages Denny's.

So I get home, and its about 12:30 in the morn and I realize...FUCK TOM HAS MY KEY! So I call him, and of course, he doesn't pick up because...well, again its 12:30am. So Mission Impossible Style, I extract my screen from my windows, and jimmy the window open, raise the blinds, and proceed to climb on in...however, in the process, I spilled a big gulp sized cup of water that was on my window sil ALL OVER THE FUCKING BED!

Which is the sole reason that I am posting on LiveJournal at 1:24am after a 13 hour day at work!

I should have went out and drank in honor of Cinco De Mayo...at least then the spilled water could be attributed to drunkness.


Out,
Thomas
http://giveit2gem.livejournal.com/53650.html

So it is 9:29am on my only day off it seems...and I am about to get ready for a friends wedding...

I would prefer to be sleeping (no offense Lita, but I'm exhausted)...and this whole wedding thing makes me feel old...

Yeah...a wedding and memorial service in the same week :-/

R.I.P. Ian...I miss you already bro.

Out,
Thomas

So I have dusted off the ole' keyboard, and decided that at this point in my life...I should start using LiveJouranl again...

Maybe the boredom of Lady Lake has finally taken its toll on me, or maybe I just need a place I can write to express random things that are on my mind...but either way...I am BACK!

So yeah...

Out,

Write 20 random facts about yourself. Write down the time you started and when you finished. For each minute it took you to complete the list, tag that number of people to do the same.

2:10AM

1.My job is something I never thought I'd be doing at 21.
2.I drive a 2005 Nissan Altima 2.5s.
3.I wish I could go back and change things from past. I was a real ass to some people :-(
4.I actually miss high school (the care free part of it).
5.It is true that the more money you make, the more you spend :-/
6.I am getting better at golf.
7.I wish I had my own house.
8.I have some insecurities that people don't know about.
9.My personality covers those insecurities.
10.I miss my family.
11.My cat died two days ago...R.I.P. Ollie.
12.I miss my grandma alot.
13.I hate spending time alone.
14.Being alone is my biggest fear.
15.I work way way, too much, but I love my job.
16.I miss writing more than I thought I ever would.
17.Never thought I'd say it, but I miss the hell out of Citus County.
18.I am the biggest MySpace whore ever ;-)
19.I need surgery on my shoulder.
20.I wish it rained all day long.

2:15AM.

I tag sugarbooger77, ameliabedelia86, limelight_lude, island_crush, empty_box14

the lovely Kelsie Ruff interviewed me:

Here is how it works!

1. Leave me a comment that says 'interview me'.
2. I will respond with five questions.
3. You will update your journal with this explanatation.
4. You will answer the questions and post them in your update.
5. When someone says 'interview me', you will ask them five questions. 



And Kelsie asked....


1. Have you ever had your wisdom teeth out?
no, and that is good, id look like the stay puffed marshmellow man if i did, my cheeks are fat as it is!

2. When, most recently, did you want to say something and stopped yourself?
the other day, when talking to my ex, she is making the same mistakes with her new bf that she did with me, but im gonna let her live and learn

3. Would you eat Vegetable Chicken baby food if you could only eat soft foods?
Don't ask me a question to justify your only food option right now ;-)

4. If you could have three superhero powers, what would they be, and why?

id want to fly, id want to be seen by no one, and id want a swwwweeeet ride like the bat mobile. flying because, well, all the ladies would want me then ;-) invisible, so if i crashed becasue i suddently found out i didnt know how to fly, no one would see me, and a pimp bat mobile ride because, well, flying isnt for me.

5. What is your biggest pet peeve?
biggest pet peave is people that use incorrect grammar, and act urban when they arent.

So Fred and Robin left for vacation tonight. 

I came back from visiting a friend in Leesburg to find this on the fish tank:

Uncle Tom,
Our parents are going away so please feed us every day. We'll remind you in the morning by scooting all the way to one side of the tank. Don't forget to put the garbage out Wednesday night. ( Mommy might get mad if you dont :-) ) They get home Sunday night, so make sure the place is clean & we won't tell them what wen on while they were gone.

Love Always,
The Fuckers.

The Fuckers, if you haven't figure it out, are what Fred and Robin and myself call the fish!

That is all that I have for now.

Out,
Thomas


OOOHH OOOHH P.S. I saw a live possum tonight. Those fuckers are ugly. Now I know why they always get hit by cars!

So yeah, Vector Alarm called me at like 1:00AM.

Good thing I live with Fred.

We went to the store and were met by like 6 cops and a K-9 unit...apparently alot of zones went off...think it was a power surge.

Fucking Florida and its unstable power grids.

That is about it...

Out,
Thomas

Well, today, I got some nuts.

Now now, get your head out of the gutter (dirty little people)

I actually got a can of nuts in the mail, courtesy of Ocala Nissan. 

Why you may ask is Ocala Nissan corresponding with me via the United States Postal Service? Well, I bought a car from them. 

A 2005 Nissan Altima 2.5s to be precise. It is black, and beautiful!

Did it a few weeks ago. I guess if I updated more, you all would know that anyway. But yea, bought a car, and they sent me nuts. Kind of a nice gesture, cept for the fact that they arrived in the mail the same day as my first $445 car payment.

Also, in other earth shattering news, I am going to have the honor of grand opening a brand spankin' new Circuit City, in The Villages. Long drive, but it will be worth it. I will be updating you all on how that is going over the next few weeks, as I plan to sign onto this bad boy everyday now (hell I should since I paid for an account!)

I don't have much else to say at this point. But if you are hella surprised to see I updated again, shoot me a comment! Show some love people!

Out,
Thomas
http://giveit2gem.livejournal.com/48284.html

So it has been a while since I posted.

Sorry. Been working tons lately.

Work is good, Life is better. Been hanging out with ADC alot lately...she makes me smile. Glad she has been around to talk to. 

Gotta love it.

Played golf today with Tim and Josh. I bought clubs last week, and this is the first time I had used them. I shaved 10 strokes off my score from last time...shot a 75 today at Candler Hills on the front 9...nothing great, but I think I am getting a little bit better.

Also, I traded in like 8 old PS2 games for NCAA Football 06. So yeah, I played a lil PS2 today...good times :-D

That is about it..vacation starts on the 22nd...if you wanna hang out...shoot me a comment!

Out,
Thomas

Today was like some sort of weird ass deja vu. I got home at 8:30am after the remodel, and slept till 6pm. Which was great to get that kind of sleep...last time I got to sleep during a day like that was the day after Project Graduation. Long time ago. Well yeah, after I woke up tonight, I went to Outback with Amy and some of her friends from the hospital...which is the SAME restaurant I ate at the day after Project Graduation (hey I have a weird memory for things like that)...so then I'm driving home, and it has been wet out all day, and someone was cutting grass, and the smell took me back to the CHS days of football....maybe these are all signs telling me I miss Citrus County more than I thought I would?

I need to make a trip back home soon!...things were so carefree when your young! Ugh, responsibillity blows!

Out,
Thomas

Well, it's 5:23am and I am at work...and NO I did NOT just get here, I've been here since 9:00pm babysitting a crew of contractors who are running cables for our new RPOS (Retail Point Of Sale)....yeah, needless to say I HATE life right now...I will be sleeping all day today...Friday...leave me lots of messaging telling me how much you feel for me ;-)

Out,
Thomas
http://giveit2gem.livejournal.com/47019.html

So yeah today, I was going to my mom's for dinner...and I drove my car through a puddle in the pouring rain. For those of you who dont know me, I drive a 98 Honda Civic, that is lowered 2.5" and has a Cold Air Intake that is pretty close to the ground. Well yeah, the intake sucked some water into the engine, and it stalled RIGHT there in the rain. I got SOAKED pushing it into a parking spot, and then, instead of enjoying a nice night with my family, I had to rummage through a tool collection at my mom's to find a rachet and socket that would allow me to take the spark plugs out. By a slight chance of luck, she just so had the EXACT tools i need so I could get all the water out of the cylinders in the car to prevent it from hydrolocking. I got the car running, and came home, only to find out that the AC is broken, and the house is at a steamy 86 degrees. I HATE MY LIFE!

DAMNIT MAN!

Out,
Thomas
http://giveit2gem.livejournal.com/46828.html

Well I am back.

Sorry I have not posted in a while...I know that you, as an avid reader of my journal...have certainly missed me.

I have been really busy with work, and for the first time in 6 months, I have been actually enjoying life and having fun, rather than feeling like a caged animal.

I will be updating almost every day now...be prepared!

Also, hit me up on myspace!

It has been a little bit since I have updated, so I will try to recap, yet keep it short, because I have somewhere to be shortly.

I still have not moved all my stuff from my apartment, but that will be done this Thursday.

Work has been very busy, and my camera sales people are tearing things up. I feel that the contest will be ours before long! (We are competeting with the rest of the stores in my district for a 250 dollar team get together...I will keep you posted.)

I played golf for the first time yesterday. Went to the driving range with Tim Scott. It was freaking awesome! I think that next month, when I get paid I am going to buy some clubs and try to go once a week. I was killing the ball off the tee in comparison to what I USED to do. I was hitting tee shots between 175-225 all day long. It was awesome. Good to get out and be active. 

Have been hanging out with some people lately that I have been meaning to see, but I never seemed to have the time. Jill Bandhauer and Lindsey Dunn came up and stayed the other night. That was fun...we went to Bennigan's with Josh, Fred, and Mark from Circuit Ciy. Mark's last was that night, so it was kind iof a send off for him also.

I went to an Intel trainiing in Tampa with Vinny and James. It was awesome. We represented Ocala hard core. Vinny won a $600 mother board and processor set. Big ups to the Italian Stallion. After the training we got to see Star Wars Episodde 3.

My suggestion...SEE IT NOW! STOP READING THIS AND GO SEE IT!

The effects were breath taking.

I hung out with Hollie the other night, whom I hadn't seen for ages. That was a blast, and hopefully we can do it again soon.

That brings me to today...

Lizabeth is coming by later, We FINALLY got to hang out last night. She is an AMAZING PERSON! I have alot in common with her. Today should be tons of fun. Nothing by laying around and watching movies. God I am SO lazy.

Out,
Thomas
http://giveit2gem.livejournal.com/45501.html

Today at work was blah...

The cats are taking well to the new room at Fred's.

This living situation is MUCH better than the last.

My bank account is fucked up. STUPID HONDA!

Punk'd on MTV is a DUMB ass SHOW.

That is about it for now...

I think these posts need more substance from now on...

Out,
Thomas E. Gemkow
http://giveit2gem.livejournal.com/45087.html

Wow.

So I have lived at Fred's less than a week, and well, there have been two motorcycle crashes in less than a week involving his friends.

Weird eh?

A few days ago, Walid crashed on a closed course in Jennings, Florida.

So I get home today tonight and Fred, Robin, Chip and a friend of theres whos name I did NOT catch were out riding.

I was just minding my own business, layed out watching October Sky (great movie by the way) and I hear a bike pull up. 

I was like "Hmmm they only left a few minutes ago, whats up?"

So Robin comes inside after riding Fred's bike home and tells me that Chip wrecked.

I got dressed went and helped Fred load Chip's bike up, then I came home.

Am I a bad omen?

Out,
Thomas
http://giveit2gem.livejournal.com/44848.html

So, I am moved.
89% moved.

Still have to transport some small stuff from the grimey apartment to my moms place for safe keeping.

Then the move will be in the 100% complete stage.

Yay for being moved.

Yay for Fred charging cheap rent.

Yay for being away from the drama.

But my room, it is very two tone purple.

Only a real man could tolerate so much ;-)


And I am doing just fine from a toleration standpoint!


Out,
Thomas
http://giveit2gem.livejournal.com/44656.html

Thanks to Miss Janie Pope, here are some pictures from the Cinco de Mayo bash at Shane's It is nights like this that are going to make me miss the hell out of Carlton Arms....but I guess you can leave a place and still visit right? These are pics of me and my co-workers living it up, and celebrating the independence of the Mexicans! Me and the LOVELY Miss Janie Pope! That is me pimpin' my hat again, Janie and Neil, the new kid at work from Mississippi! Me and Nigel, a former Circuit City employee...notice the Jell-O shot in hand, one of a party record 18 for the night! Only me and Broseph could pull of the hats.... How YOU doin? Steve, James, Neil and Shane Shane and Nigel Shane and his girlfriend Jessica....got to love her and her themed parties! I speak for us all when I say we are grateful for their shindigs! WTF are you doing to that bottle Joe? DONT BE SO GRIMEY! Walid and Janie Me and James That is about all for the pics. Another great party and Shane Jess and Walid's in the books. Now it is time to go start packing things up so I can start moving them later this weekend. LIFE IS GREAT!! Out, Thomas

Your Birthdate: November 23
With a birthday on the 23rd of the month (5 energy) you are inclined to work well with people and enjoy them. You are talented and versatile, very good at presenting ideas. You may have a tendency to get itchy feet at times and need change and travel. You tend to be very progressive, imaginative and adaptable. Your mind is quick, clever and analytical. A restlessness in your nature may make you a bit impatient and easily bored with routine. You may have a tendency to shirk responsibility. Very sociable, you make friends easily and you are an excellent traveling companion.
